newsitem.title: CHINA: China to keep tight money policy in '97 - premier.
newsitem.headline: China to keep tight money policy in '97 - premier.

text.p: China will maintain an appropriately tight monetary policy in 1997, Chinese Premier Li Peng said in his annual government work report to the National People's Congress, or parliament, on Saturday.
China imposed a credit squeeze in mid-1993 but has shown signs of easing that slightly in recent months, cutting interest rates twice last year.
Li said China would continue to restructure its loans policy to favour production and construction, and said state banks would strive to reduce their costs. He gave no more details.
He adopted a cautious note on development of securities and futures markets, offering little shift from a three-year crackdown on market irregularities.
"We must regulate the securities and futures market and increase our sense of risk," Li said.
